parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From Kaisar; Caesaria, the name of two places in Palestine.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To send up, deliver, hand over, yield. From ana and didomi; to hand over.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A letter, dispatch, epistle, message. From epistello; a written message.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From hegeomai; a leader, i.e. Chief person of a province.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Or prolonged paristano from para and histemi; to stand beside, i.e. to exhibit, proffer, recommend, substantiate; or to be at hand, aid.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
